definition: to resign oneself to part with what one treasures
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
ache/pain/sorrow/deeply/thoroughly
to cut/to cut apart
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: Did you know that I am also your fan, but I am willing to reluctantly part with.
sentences.chinese: 您清楚我也是您的影迷，不过我愿意忍痛割爱。

sentences.english: When this happens, it’s best to bite the bullet and drop or delay a project or two.
sentences.chinese: 当这发生时，最好忍痛割爱，放弃或推迟一两个计划。

sentences.english: Would you live with ease, do what you ought, and not what you please.
sentences.chinese: 要想活得轻松自在，时时都要忍痛割爱。

sentences.english: If you would live with ease, do what you ought, and not what you please.
sentences.chinese: 要想活得轻松自在，时时都要忍痛割爱。

definition: to suffer/fig. reluctantly
to part with sth cherished/to forsake
to settle for second best/the next best thing
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
to tackle a difficult job (idiom)/to do sth reluctantly
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to give away/to accompany/to see sb off
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
to drop (subject etc)
callous/heartless
to sell cheaply/sacrifice/low price/discount sale
without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
to have no way out/to have no alternative
to be willing to part with sth
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
to give up/to abandon/to abort
